content.html:
@bascht There are three data structures (that I know of!) in #EmacsLisp for key-value pairs. It looks like this one is a plist (key1 value1 key2 value2 ...), not a hash table. There are also alists ((key1 . value1) (key2 . value2) ...). Each has their own set of functions to manipulate them, so in this case you want plist-get. https://emacsdocs.org/docs/elisp/Property-Lists

Broad pros/cons: plists are convenient to create (i.e. nice function arguments), alists simplify looping over pairs, and hash tables scale up well

emacslisp 5.9 Property Lists | Emacs Docs
